author: Angelos Chalaris
message: Add n-gram fuzzy matching strategy  n-grams are employed with a weight of 0.7, by default. They are used as a complementary means to match documents, but can also be employed as a fallback in case there are no matching documents via TF-IDF search.

author: Angelos Chalaris
message: Prevent error flash when JS is enabled  When JS is enabled, there's a very brief moment when the content web components haven't loaded just yet, so the user sees a flash of the error message. To prevent this, we can use a `noscript` tag, along with the styles added into it, so that the error message will only appear for users with JS disabled completely.

message: Add an article about OS detection

author: Angelos Chalaris
message: Switch out partial matching for a better implementation  Use the regular TF-IDF formula, except the frequency is calculated as the sum of the partially matched terms as seen in the index.

author: Angelos Chalaris
message: Add partial matching to search  If there's an incompelte search term as the last term, the search will attempt to use the token strategy with a simulated IDF to partially match it to any document. This allows for incomplete search terms, e.g. `javasc` to be matched against any document proportionally to the partial search term's length, providing a better experience while typing a search term, instead of only matching when the query is complete.
